title: granblue_fantasy
body:
[b]Granblue Fantasy[/b] (グランブルーファンタジー [i]Guranburuu Fantajii[/i]), officially abbreviated as [b]Granblue[/b] (グラブル [i]Guraburu[/i]), is a mobile turn-based RPG by [[Cygames]], with a Japanese-only release in March 2014, and an English-language release in April 2016. The official anime released in 2017, followed by a second season in 2019. 

The gameplay is heavily reliant on the player's summons and weapons obtained from the gacha system and from in-game raids. The player can equip a maximum of ten weapons and five summons at a time and this is generally referred to as the "weapon grid" and "summon pool".

Granblue is infamous for its competitive week-long event (Guild Wars/Unite & Fight/古戦場) where players farm chunks of meat and try to score more points than their opponent crew for hours at a time. Art is occasionally drawn depicting this in game event, one example being [[post guild war celebration]]s.

h4. Races

Most characters in Granblue Fantasy are divided into 5 races. 

* Human. Most characters fall into this.
* [[Erune]], whose notable features are their animal ears and clothing that expose their backs.
* [[Harvin]], dwarf sized humanoids.
* [[Draph]], humanoids with prominent horns on their heads. Males are tall and muscular, while females are noticeably shorter than the average person, while having big breasts.
* Primal. Primal beasts are creatures that were crafted by the Astral beings long ago. A good number of them (usually humanoid) end up joining the player's crew for one reason or another. 

h4. Protagonist

The player is represented by either [[Gran_(granblue_fantasy)|]] or [[Djeeta_(granblue_fantasy)|]] based on their gender selection and this can be changed at any time. The player may also change their class at any time which also changes their costume.

h4. Characters

Major story characters include:
* [[lyria (granblue fantasy)|Lyria]] 
* [[vyrn (granblue fantasy)|Vyrn]] 
* [[katalina (granblue fantasy)|Katalina]] 
* [[eugen_(granblue_fantasy)|Eugen]] 
* [[io (granblue fantasy)|Io]] 
* [[rackam (granblue fantasy)|Rackam]] 
* [[rosetta (granblue fantasy)|Rosetta]] 

For a full list of characters including NPCs, see the "English wiki list":[https://gbf.wiki/All_Characters] or the Japanese wiki list (for "Playable Characters":[https://gbf-wiki.com/index.php?%C1%B4%A5%AD%A5%E3%A5%E9%A5%AF%A5%BF%A1%BC%B0%EC%CD%F7] and for "NPC Characters":[https://gbf-wiki.com/index.php?%A5%B9%A5%C8%A1%BC%A5%EA%A1%BC%A5%AD%A5%E3%A5%E9]).

h4. See also

* [[Granblue Fantasy Versus]]
* [[Granblue Fantasy Versus: Rising]]
* [[Granblue Fantasy: Relink]]

h4. External links

* "Official Granblue Fantasy Twitter (Japanese)":https://twitter.com/granbluefantasy/
* "Granblue Fantasy Wiki (EN)":https://gbf.wiki/
* "Granblue Fantasy Wiki (JP)":http://gbf-wiki.com/
* "Granblue Fantasy Image Viewer":https://gbf-img.com/
* "Wikipedia: Granblue Fantasy":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Granblue_Fantasy

title: dune_(2021_movie)
body:
[b]Dune: Part One[/b] is a 2021 movie adaptation of the first half of the original [i][[dune_(series)|Dune]][/i] novel from the 60s by Frank Herbert, directed by "Denis Villeneuve":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Denis_Villeneuve. Originally scheduled for release in late [[2020]], it was "one of the many films delayed by COVID-19":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_films_impacted_by_the_COVID-19_pandemic, and was released on 22 October, 2021 both in [[movie theater|theaters]] and on streaming on HBO MAX (in the [[United States]]). A sequel titled [i][[Dune: Part Two]][/i] was released worldwide on March 1, 2024, also directed by Denis Villeneuve. 

It was the second film adaption of [i]Dune[/i] after [[dune (1984 movie)|David Lynch's Dune]] in [[1984 (year)|1984]], and the third on-screen adaption since the [i]"Frank Herbert's Dune":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_Herbert%27s_Dune[/i] miniseries in [[2000]].

h4.See also
* [[Dune: Part Two]]
* [[Dune (series)]]

title: yuki_onna
body:
Yuki-onna (雪女, lit.  [i]snow woman[/i]) is a [[traditional youkai]] in Japanese mythology. She is often depicted as a tall, beautiful woman with long hair that appears during snowy nights, with inhumanly pale or even transparent skin that blends in with the snow and gives her a [[ghost]]ly appearance. In some stories, the yuki onna displays [[demon girl]]-like traits.

h4. Notable Yuki Onna

* [[Letty Whiterock]] from [[Touhou]]
* [[Aoi (GeGeGe no Kitarou)|Aoi]] from [[GeGeGe no Kitarou]]

title: star_wars:_the_high_republic
body:
A multimedia subseries of the [[Star Wars]] franchise, first released in 2021. The High Republic introduces a new era in the Disney canon, set between 500 to 100 years prior to the films. 

Currently, The High Republic series consists of several novels, comics, and audio dramas, as well as official works originally created in other languages, including a Japanese manga series and a Chinese web novel. The upcoming Disney+ steaming series "The Acolyte" is also set in the High Republic era.

title: cross
body:
A symbol or object that consists of two intersecting perpendicular lines, with one or both lines divided in half by the intersection.

Ancient religions used the cross as a symbol of the sun. Christianity uses it as a symbol representing the cross on which Jesus was crucified.

This tag refers to any cross-shaped symbol or physical object.

h4. Related tags

h6. Basic Shapes

* [[Greek Cross]] (A cross with 4 equal length arms, + symbol)
* [[Latin Cross]] (A cross with with a longer descending arm, † symbol)
* [[Saltire]] (A diagonal cross, x symbol) 

h6.  Combined Shapes

* [[Sun Cross]] (A Greek cross inside a circle)
* [[Celtic Cross]] (A Greek or Latin cross with a circle overlaid)

h6. Cross End Shapes (combines with the basic shapes)

* [[Arrow Cross]] (Arrow ends)
* [[Cross Bottony]] (Trefoil or club ends)
* Cross Crosslet (Cross ends)
* [[Cross Fitchy]] (Descending arm ends with a point)
* [[Cross Fleury]] ([[fleur-de-lis|Fleur-de-lis]] ends)
* [[Cross Moline]] (Ends split into two and curve back)
* [[Cross Potent]] (Crossbar ends)
* [[Cross Patonce]] (Intermediate of Patty and Fleury ends, splits into 3 and leaf shaped)
* [[Cross Patty]] (Wide ends that narrow toward the center)

h6. Cross Positioning and Scale

* [[Inverted Cross]]
* [[Large Cross]]

h6. Cross Symbols

* [[Balkenkreuz]]  (a Greek cross with an outline)
* [[Cross of Lorraine]] (cross with two horizontal bars, also known as the two-barred cross or patriarchal cross)
* [[Crucifix]] (a Latin cross with [[Jesus]] affixed to it)
* [[Orthodox Cross]] (similar to a Latin cross with a smaller bar crossing above the the central cross and a smaller slanted cross on the base arm)
* [[Iron Cross]] (a Greek cross with cross patty ends)
* [[Maltese cross]] (an eight-pointed cross made from four inward-pointing V shapes)
* [[Red Cross]] (a red Greek cross)
* [[Swastika]] (an equilateral cross with arms that are bent 90 degrees)

h6. Other Crosses

* [[Cross of Saint Andrew]] (For physical saltire cross used for crucifixion)
* [[Crosier]] (A staff topped with a cross)
* [[Crux (constellation)|]] (A cross-shaped constellation)

Its most notable feature is the raised collar with glowing lights on the inside. The back of the jacket displays Samurai's logo, a red cybernetic [[oni mask]].

Other characters wearing this jacket should not be tagged with V unless they're specifically cosplaying them.

title: fremen
body:
The [b]Fremen[/b] (pronounced /ˈfrɛmən/) are a group of people in the fictional [[Dune (series)|]] universe created by Frank Herbert. 

First appearing in the 1965 [[science fiction]] novel [i]Dune[/i], the Fremen inhabit the [[desert]] [[planet]] [[Dune (planet)|Arrakis]] and are based on the desert-dwelling Bedouin and Kalahari Bushmen. 

In Herbert's novels, Arrakis (also known as Dune) is the sole known source of the all-important spice melange in the universe. 

The Fremen originated from human refugees and outcasts from different planetary colonies who traveled across space and ended in the then unexplored desert planet centuries in the past, becoming initially a group known as "The [b]Fre[/b]e [b]Men[/b] of Arrakis". 

As humans [i]in extremis[/i], over time they adapted their culture and way of life to survive and thrive in the incredibly harsh conditions of Arrakis. The Fremen are distinguished by their fierce fighting abilities and adeptness at survival in these conditions. With [[water]] such a rare commodity on the planet, their culture revolves around its preservation and conservation.

The Fremen spend all time out in the desert inside a [[stillsuit]], a special body-enclosing suit designed to collect and recycle body water.

It is generally considered a great sign of respect (though often interpreted otherwise) for a Fremen to spit [[saliva]] before a person, because of their water conservation routine. They also put a great reverence on crying. [[Tears]] shed for someone who has died are referred to as "Water Given To The Dead."

h4. See also

* [[Dune (series)]]
* [[Dune (2021 movie)]]
* [[Chani]]
* [[Stilgar]]

* [[Crysknife]]

* [[Sandworm]]

A high-school romance manga and anime series originally created by [[Matsumoto Izumi]] and published on [[Weekly Shounen Jump]] in the 1980s. The anime's character designer was [[Takada Akemi]], who has produced a number of artworks related to the show throughout her career.

Matsumoto Izumi passed away on October 6, 2020.

* [[Kasuga Kurumi]]

title: queadluun-rea
body:
[[Zentradi]] one-man tactical aerospace [[power armor]] that first appeared in the [[Macross Frontier]] TV series from 2008. 

It is very similar to the [[Queadluun-Rau]] [[power suit]] from [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]] and [[Macross: Do You Remember Love?]]. However, this [[mecha]] is even faster and has a more powerful thermonuclear reactor as well as an additional long-range beam [[cannon]] on its left shoulder (like the [[Nousjadeul-Ger]] [[power armor]]), giving it more anti-capital ship capabilities. 

The Rea was developed by the [[N.U.N.S.]] for the Zentradi ally fleets. The latest type ([i]Rea/56[/i]) is deployed with Zentradi immigration fleets and planetary migration missions.

This is the mecha of choice for [[Klan Klein]] and the [[Meltrandi]] [[S.M.S.]] Pixie Squadron.

In [[real life]] the Rea was designed by [[Ishigaki Jun'ya]] based on the original 80s design by [[Miyatake Kazutaka]].

h4. See also

* [[Queadluun-Nona]]
* [[Queadluun-Rau]]

title: bruno_j._global
body:
A fictional character from the [[MACROSS]] [[science fiction]] series.

He first appeared in the [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]] TV series from 1982.

[[U.N. Spacy]] officer [b]Bruno J. Global[/b] is the acting Captain of the [[SDF-1]] Macross [[military]] [[spacecraft]]. He is of [[italy|Italian]] ethnicity and very skilled in ship-to-ship space combat strategy. His previous command was in an [[Oberth]] Class U.N. Spacy [[space]] destroyer. 

His name was changed to [b]Henry J. Gloval[/b] (a diminutive of [b]Glovalsky[/b]) and his ethnicity to [[Russia]]n in the [[ROBOTECH]] American adaptation.

The character design of [[nemo_(nadia)|Captain Nemo]] from [[Fushigi No Umi No Nadia]] was inspired by Global.

title: hayase_misa
body:
A fictional female character from [[MACROSS]].

[b]Hayase Misa[/b] is one of the main characters from the [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]] TV series from 1982. She also appears in the [[Macross: Do You Remember Love?]] movie and in archival footage and flashbacks in the [[Macross Flashback 2012]] OVA. 

Misa is a [[Japan]]ese member of the [[U.N. Spacy]] and the chief tactical officer at the bridge of the [[SDF-1]] MACROSS variable [[spacecraft]]. 

She's a young [[Asian]] woman with long [[brown hair]]. Misa is a strong-willed, determined and down-to-earth type of person, completely immersed in doing her [[military]] duty. She created the [[Daedalus Attack]]. Misa is also [[Claudia LaSalle]]'s best friend. 

In [[real life]] during 1983 the character of Hayase Misa won the first [[Animage]] Grand Prix Award ever for "Best Female Character" in Japanese anime.

In the [[Robotech]] western adaptation her name was changed to [[Lisa Hayes]] and her ethnicity to [[united_states|American]].

h4. See also

* [[Ichijou Hikaru]]
* [[Lynn Minmay]]

title: bikini_top_only
body:
Wearing a bikini top without a bikini bottom. For example, wearing a bikini top with [[shorts]] or [[pants]], or while completely [[bottomless]].

Don't use when you can't see the character's lower body, or you can't tell whether they're wearing bikini bottoms or not. This tag is for when you can tell they're not wearing a bikini bottom.

Don't use when the character is a wearing a [[bikini skirt]], [[bikini shorts]], [[sarong]], or other bottom normally worn with a bikini top.

h4. See also

* [[Bikini bottom only]]
